intro: Alsodeia elliptica, commonly known as the narrowleaf alsike, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant has slender, upright stems and small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, appearing in clusters and blooming in late spring to early summer. Alsodeia elliptica is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
